meanings.definition: A room situated at the rear of a building, typically used for storage or other purposes.
meanings.sent1: In the backrooms of the library, old books are stored.
meanings.sent2: The janitor found a broom in the backrooms of the school.
meanings.sent3: During the game of hide-and-seek, the backrooms became the perfect hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a cluttered backrooms, full of forgotten memories.
meanings.sent5: The backrooms smelled of dust and old paper, creating a nostalgic atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The hidden or less visible areas of a place, often associated with secrecy or mystery.
meanings.sent1: Exploring the backrooms of the mansion revealed a hidden passage.
meanings.sent2: The backrooms of the store held many surprises for the curious shopper.
meanings.sent3: The backrooms of the office seemed to have a life of their own, rearranging files mysteriously.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts wandered into the backrooms of her mind, where secrets were buried.
meanings.sent5: The backrooms of the old castle whispered tales of forgotten times.
